description: Monitor executed commands and arguments that may gather credentials from information stored in the Proc filesystem or /proc. For instance, adversaries may use regex patterns to search for process memory that may be exfiltrated or searched for credentials.(Citation: atomic-red proc file system)(Citation: mimipenguin proc file) grep -E "^[0-9a-f-]* r" /proc/"$pid"/maps | grep -E 'heap|stack' | cut -d' ' -f 1 grep -E "^[0-9a-f-]* r" /proc/"$PID"/maps | grep heap | cut -d' ' -f 1 Analytic 1 - Unexpected access to /proc filesystem. index=os sourcetype="linux_audit" command IN ("grep -E '^[0-9a-f-]* r' /proc/*/maps", "cat /proc/*/maps", "awk '{print $1}' /proc/*/maps")

external_references.description: Atomic Red Team. (2023, November). T1003.007 - OS Credential Dumping: Proc Filesystem. Retrieved March 28, 2024.
Gregal, Hunter. (2019, September 17). MimiPenguin 2.0. Retrieved March 28, 2024.
